comment.body: i'd prefer just pressing [enter] , guess that just me, shortcuts helps tho :)
is this suppose to be waifu material? :3
fluff ball @.@
@Styromaniac: i can't tho, sadly for private reasons. still ill keep mine running as long as i could to support :)
omg i was about to share this too @.@//
@Diligentslacker: i know this is ZeroNet but it still feels off not to credit the creator tho. Given that people could search for the title should we add {creator} - {name} or {name} - {creator}?
@Tusiko: haha, me too :P
I did mostly nothing, things just goes like normal days these two years :P
@Tusiko: glad you guys had a wonderful time :)
welcome, you might wanna try guessing who am i >:)

@Bigbadbob: hmm weird, I have no idea why :x

hint: You've met me before, but I was a different creature OwO
@Bigbadbob: yep~~ >:) you're getting close

@Bigbadbob: hmm two, made that one since I didnt find this old acc, but found it exactly 1 day afterward *facepalm* . True, well I hardly hide my ip so it doesnt matter too much if someone seriously want to find out who I am xD

@Styromaniac: well in the words of of Neil Degrasse Tyson,

---
 "*Imagine another life form. That’s 1% different from us. In the direction that we are different from the chimp. Think about that. We have 1% difference and we are building the Hubble telescope. Go another 1%. What are we to they? We would be drooling, blithering idiots in their presence. That’s what we would be.*"

---
Clip on KopyKate: [Neal Degrasse Tyson on Humans and Chimps](http://127.0.0.1:43110/big.kopykate.bit/?Video=1566531806_1BP5GrM5EDw9SVGmRJan1kvQ2DB2Xm1Rgo)
Original one on Youtube: [link](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BhaE3w5QCGg) (CleanWeb) 


dont mind me, imma go and repost this comment muhahehehahhhah~!
@Bigbadbob: hmm could be a thing, but wouldnt that be very ineffecient? just build a swarm of tiny, self replicating robots doing the job be better?

@Bigbadbob: ~well, we passed the cold war, now on to global climate catastophy. I think robots gonna have to wait :x~


Hmm we didn't get wiped out by epidemics, increased the earth's carrying capacity by billions through the [Haber–Bosch process](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haber_process) (Wikipedia/CleanWeb), passed the cold war without dying from our stupidness, now on to climate catastrophe, wonders when will be the machine's turn :p

@caryoscelus:  also our ability to pass our knowledge through generations, creating the cumulative advancement that we know today, our brain is still 99.9999... % the same as our primitive thousands of years ago tho xD

@Bigbadbob: well life always throw shit at you and with enough times, some of them does stick, sadly. Still I'm glad that you're going along, we could always wish our past change but looking forward is the only thing we could practically do. I hope you're doing well, always nice to find someone reasonable to talk to :)

@Pexo: indeed it did :D
Again, but good to see you back!
@Iloveguac: +1
